Authors: Chandra N., Chin R.S., Cardova E., Pratiwi M.D., Nadia
Title: Implementation of Gyroscope Sensor to Presentation Application on Android Smartphone
Source title: 1st 2018 Indonesian Association for Pattern Recognition International Conference, INAPR 2018 - Proceedings
Affiliations: School of Computer Science, Computer Science Department, Mobile Application and Technology Program, Bina Nusantara, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; School of Computer Science, Computer Science Department, Computer Science Program, Bina Nusantara, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Chandra, N., School of Computer Science, Computer Science Department, Mobile Application and Technology Program, Bina Nusantara, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Chin, R.S., School of Computer Science, Computer Science Department, Mobile Application and Technology Program, Bina Nusantara, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Cardova, E., School of Computer Science, Computer Science Department, Mobile Application and Technology Program, Bina Nusantara, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Pratiwi, M.D., School of Computer Science, Computer Science Department, Mobile Application and Technology Program, Bina Nusantara, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Nadia, School of Computer Science, Computer Science Department, Computer Science Program, Bina Nusantara, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: Smartphones nowadays can detect movement and orientation of the device. This technology can be applied and used by the user to simplify everyday tasks. One task that user do in everyday life is doing presentation. In most lecturing and presentation sessions, many presentations will be involved by either the students, or lecturer and other people. One method that will be used to help the user is by implementing gyroscope sensors that available on most modern smartphone. This allows the user to navigate and point at any object on presentation slide without doing it manually or help from other tools such as laser pointer. The purpose of this research is to develop a smartphone app based on android to help user, primarily on presentations by using gyroscope sensor. © 2018 IEEE.
Index Keywords: Gyroscopes; Pattern recognition; Sensors; Smartphones; Android; Android smartphone; Gyroscope sensors; Laser pointer; Presentation slides; Presentations; Android (operating system)

Authors: Tarigan J., Nadia, Diedan R., Suryana Y.
Title: Plate Recognition Using Backpropagation Neural Network and Genetic Algorithm
Affiliations: Bina Nusantara University, Jl. Kebon Jeruk Raya No. 27, Kebon Jeruk, Jakarta Barat, 11530, Indonesia; BPPT, Jl. MH.Thamrin No.8, Jakarta, 10340, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Tarigan, J., Bina Nusantara University, Jl. Kebon Jeruk Raya No. 27, Kebon Jeruk, Jakarta Barat, 11530, Indonesia; Nadia, Bina Nusantara University, Jl. Kebon Jeruk Raya No. 27, Kebon Jeruk, Jakarta Barat, 11530, Indonesia; Diedan, R., Bina Nusantara University, Jl. Kebon Jeruk Raya No. 27, Kebon Jeruk, Jakarta Barat, 11530, Indonesia; Suryana, Y., BPPT, Jl. MH.Thamrin No.8, Jakarta, 10340, Indonesia
Abstract: Plate recognizer system is an important system. It can be used for automatic parking gate or automatic ticketing system. The purpose of this study is to determine the effectiveness of Genetic Algorithms (GA) in optimizing the number of hidden neurons, learning rate and momentum rate on Backpropagation Neural Network (BPNN) that is applied to the Automatic Plate Number Recognizer (APNR). Research done by building a GA optimized BPNN (GABPNN) and APNR system using image processing methods, including grayscale conversion, top-hat transformation, binary morphological, Otsu threshold and binary image projection. The tests conducted with backpropagation training and recognition test. The result shows that GA optimized backpropagation neural network requires 2230 epochs in the training process to be convergent, which is 36.83% faster than non-optimal backpropagation neural network, while the accuracy is 1,35% better than non-optimized backpropagation neural network. © 2017 The Authors. Published by Elsevier B.V.
Author Keywords: Bacpropagation Neural Network; Computer Vision; Genetic Algorithm; Optical Character Recognition; Top-Hat Transformation

Authors: Kurniati A., Nadia, Tanzil F., Purnomo F.
Title: Game Development "tales of Mamochi" with Role Playing Game Concept Based on Android
Affiliations: Department of Computer Science, School of Computer Science, Binus University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Kurniati, A., Department of Computer Science, School of Computer Science, Binus University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Nadia, Department of Computer Science, School of Computer Science, Binus University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Tanzil, F., Department of Computer Science, School of Computer Science, Binus University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Purnomo, F., Department of Computer Science, School of Computer Science, Binus University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: The research objective is to create, design and develop game "Tales of Mamochi" with RPG genre which is expected to be entertaining and highly enjoyable to play in leisure time. This game has a partner (Mamochi) which assists the player to fight the ghost monster. Research methods used include method of analysis (literature review, questionnaire and analysis of similar type application), and method of design is scrum method. The result is a game which is named "Tales of Mamochi" with 2D graphic. "Tales of Mamochi" game has several feature, such as character selection, collection book, battle (PVE), crafting, mamochi evolution, farm, cooking and quest. In conclusion, "Tales of Mamochi" is a game application which is entertainable. It has an explosive story, gameplay and vivid interface which becomes the main lure of selecting this game. © 2015 Published by Elsevier B.V.
Index Keywords: Android (operating system); Artificial intelligence; Interactive computer graphics; Android; Game; Game development; Literature reviews; Method of analysis; Research objectives; Role-playing game; RPG; Software design
